title: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of California, Davis)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of California, Davis)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { California Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of California, Davis)

communications.subject: Re: Request UCDPRA23060 - California Public Records Act Request: Pepsi and Coke (UC Davis)
communications.communication:
Dear Kayla Henson / Muckrock,



UC Davis Information Practices writes to acknowledge receipt of your Public Records Act (PRA) request submitted on January 31, 2023; your request number is UCDPRA23060 which is provided below for reference. University of California offices have been notified of your request and a search for the information is underway. Please note, California Government code § 7922 (formerly codified as § 6253) requires a public agency to determine within 10 days of receipt as to whether or not a request is seeking records that exist and are publicly disclosable, and if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available. All records identified as responsive to your request will be reviewed, and released, in accordance with relevant California law and University policy. Our current response time is approximately six (6) weeks, as such the estimated date for production of the requested records is on or around March 21, 2023.

Please feel free to reply to this email should you have any questions as we work to complete your request.



Sincerely,



Kelley Walker

Information Practices Team

UC Legal – UC Davis Office of the Campus Counsel

UC Davis Office of the Campus Counsel<https://campuscounsel.ucdavis.edu/>

publicrecords@ucdavis.edu

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to learn: 1) which local, state and national law enforcement agencies can currently submit probe photos to be run through the Colorado Department of Motor Vehicles face recognition system and, 2) which law enforcement agencies actually submitted probe photos from January 1, 2020 to the date of the most recently available data.

Please provide any lists, logs or datasets showing this information.  With regard to agencies that have submitted probe photos, please provide logs, lists or datasets describing, as available, the requesting organization, the number of requests made, the dates of the requests, and the number of requests granted.  If the Department maintains this information in an Excel spreadsheet, I request that the record be produced in this format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Tepper:

We are writing in response to your Colorado Open Records Act request.  Your
request involves records that cannot be reasonably gathered, reviewed and
prepared within the three-day period without substantially interfering with
the custodian’s obligation to perform her other public services.
Accordingly, pursuant to C.R.S. 24-72- 203 (3) (b)(III), we will be taking
up to an additional seven working days to complete your request.
Regards,
Patrick Harton

*CORA Manager*
[image: co_dor_edo_rgb_Email_Sig.png (400Ã—77)]
www.colorado.gov/revenue/cora

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Tepper:

We are writing in response to your Colorado Open Records Act ("CORA")
request. Per the DMV, the Department accepts a submitted photo from any law
enforcement agency but only for the purposes of assisting with an active
criminal investigation, and except for the purposes of immigration
enforcement. See C.R.S. 42-1-206. Please see the attached documents for the
requested data.
Regards,
Patrick Harton

*CORA Manager*
[image: co_dor_edo_rgb_Email_Sig.png (400Ã—77)]
www.colorado.gov/revenue/cora

title: Gerald Mason Feigen

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Gerald Mason Feigen
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Gerald Mason Feigen. The Bureau has previously acknowledged maintaining files discussing the subject (see attached).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Gerald Mason Feigen
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Detroit)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Detroit)
communications.communication:
Dear Records Custodian,

This is a request under the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (MCL 15.231 et. seq.) for documents that detail how your community’s water system functions, including details on utility terminations, restorations, and rates.

As context for this request, I am requesting these records on behalf of the People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization that advocates for equitable access, protection, and affordability of utility services, and water conservation. We are filing similar requests for information with many other Michigan water utilities in collaboration with residents, community leaders, and local officials to better support the needs of low-income customers. If any of this information is publicly available and accessible, please send a link to the webpage where it is located. Please reply to this request via email. If you have any question or concern about this request, please call Cass Charrette at 248-980-1191.

When possible, please provide the requested quantitative data in an Excel spreadsheet or other native digital format (such as CSV files).

1. A copy of any data and documents that list the addresses and dates of residential customers that have had their water service terminated starting January 1, 2019 to date of the submission of the FOIA, the reason for the termination, and the amount of arrears for each account. If this data is produced in another format, such as written logs or summary reports, please provide a copy of that instead. If your agency has a policy that home address information is exempt from FOIA, please provide this data at the street level.

2. Any documents describing and listing the addresses and dates of residential customers that have had their water service restored starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA, following a disconnection. If this data is included in the same data set as Item 6, you may provide that full data set in lieu of processing this element separately.

3. A copy of any existing, regularly generated reports that include the total amount of water and wastewater customer arrearages, number of customers in arrears, and median amount of arrearages per customer, and number of customers subject to potential service disconnection due to arrears by customer class (e.g., residential, non-profit, commercial, industrial) starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA.

4. A copy of a list of referrals the utility/water system/municipality sent to the tax assessor to place a tax lien on properties due to non-payment of any water or sewer bill, starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA, and the amount of arrears for each account. If this information is stored in a summary database, you may provide that database.

5. Any documents describing or listing the addresses of residential customer accounts that have been enrolled in and have been discharged from the Great Lakes Water Authority’s Water Residential Assistance Program, and the reason for such removal or discharge, starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA.

As I am requesting these records as a representative of People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization, and am doing so in the public interest, I request a waiver of fees. The analysis and release of these materials will contribute significantly to public understanding of water affordability issues in the tri-county area.

I will expect a response within 5 business days as provided by law. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I expect a detailed justification for withholding the records. I also request any segregable portions that are not exempt to be disclosed.

If you have any questions or suggestions for reducing the burden of my request, please reach out and we are happy to discuss.

Sincerely,
People’s Water Board Coalition

title: Data on revocations by race and gender

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Data on revocations by race and gender
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

For 2022 or the most recent year that data is available: 
1. Number of youth on Grants of Conditional Liberty by race and gender, both statewide and by DYS regions.
2. Number of revocations of youth on Grants of Conditional Liberty by race and gender, both statewide and by DYS regions.
3. The average number of days revocated youth are held before they are returned to the community on a new Grant of Conditional Liberty, by race and gender, both statewide and by DYS regions.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Betsey Chace

title: Harry Steinmetz 11.7.22

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Harry Steinmetz 11.7.22
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all records, documents, and communications responsive to Dr. Harry Charles Steinmetz (December 8, 1898 - February 15, 1981). Dr. Steinmetz was Professor Emeritus of Psychology at San Diego State University. Between 1942 and 1980 the Federal Bureau of Investigation monitored the actions of Dr. Steinmetz as part of an ongoing program devoted to investigating suspected communists. Dr. Steinmetz sent a Freedom of Information Act request for his file in the seventies, resulting in his receiving 934 pages of documents in or about 1978.

I am requesting all responsive records issued previously to Dr. Steinmetz and any that may not have been released before his death. As verification of Dr. Steinmetz's prior FOIPA release, I am attaching correspondence between Dr. Steinmetz and the Bureau. First is a February 11, 1977 response letter from the Bureau identifying 658 pages of documents responsive to Dr. Steinmetz, and second is a response to an appeal made by Dr. Steinmetz identifying an additional 276 pages of Bureau documents. These two page counts total 934 pages of documents. This correspondence can be found in the special collections archive at San Diego State University, under Dr. Steinmetz personal effects and papers (MS-0305).

There is no expectation of a violation of Dr. Steinmetz's privacy, as he passed away in 1981. Privacy rights are not extended to deceased persons. I have attached a reproduction of Dr. Steinmetz's obituary, taken from the The Los Angeles Times, as verification. As this is information the Bureau has released to other parties, there should be no further concerns over making this information public.

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media, with bylines including Covert Action Magazine, Janata Weekly, and Philly Voice. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

title: Holocaust Survey (Mohonasen Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Survey (Mohonasen Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law.

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted since August 10, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Tulsa Public Schools CRT Investigation [Oklahoma State Department of Education]

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Tulsa Public Schools CRT Investigation [Oklahoma State Department of Education]
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

With respect to item 9(d) of the agenda for the June 23, 2022 meeting of State Board of Education, referring to "Updated report on House Bill 1775 complaint filed, and status thereof, regarding alleged violations of 70 O.S. § 24-157 and administrative rule prohibiting race and sex discrimination - 70 O.S. § 24-157; Oklahoma Administrative Code 210:10-1-23":

1. A copy of the complaint.

2. A copy of any investigative report.

3. A copy of the training materials.

4. A copy of the audio.

5. A copy of any other records provided by or obtained from Tulsa Public Schools or any other party relating to the complaint.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT - Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) FINAL SUBMISSION, drafts, notes, worksheets, communications, estimates, and working documents for years 2019 - 2021
tags: joint legislative audit and review committee (jlarc)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT - Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) FINAL SUBMISSION, drafts, notes, worksheets, communications, estimates, and working documents for years 2019 - 2021
communications.communication:
RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT - Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) FINAL SUBMISSION, drafts, notes, worksheets, communications, estimates, and working documents for years 2019 - 2021

Via email: galt.pettett@rsd.edu

To whom it may concern,

Each state and local agency with at least $100,000 of staff and legal costs associated with fulfilling public records requests in the preceding fiscal year is required to submit a report to the Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC). State and local agencies that spent less than $100,000 may voluntarily submit reports (RCW 40.14.026(5)).

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1.	Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2021. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

2.	Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2021 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2021.


3.	Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2020. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

4.	Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2020 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2020.


5.	Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2019. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

6.	Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2019 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2019.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first. 

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.
Please provide all electronic records in their native electronic format. Please do not create new records by printing native electronic files then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints for electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERICAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Public Records Requests R000001-020722, R000175-111622, R000176-111622 and R000177-111622
communications.communication:
[cid:image002.png@01D8FA93.8D4AB690]

November 17, 2022

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 120953
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Public Records Requests R000001-020722,  and New Requests

To Whom It May Concern:

On November 4, 2021 the Richland School District received your first records request. Your request was sent from the e-mail address 120953-42737343@requests.muckrock.com.  Your request sought the following records:

…all Public Records Requests received by Richland School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

 

On November 8th and 9th, the District sent you two requests for clarification.  Then on November 15, the District e-mailed you.  The body of the District’s e-mail is as follows:

This District has assigned your request with the number 1142021MR for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when corresponding about this request.

Since receiving your request, I have sent at least two requests for clarification to your group and have not heard back.  I corresponded using the portal specific to the Richland School District and assigned by your group. I have not heard back from you.

I am seeking clarification of your very large records request so that the District can provide you with an adequate response.  Is there a staff member that I can speak to for this clarification?  Understanding that you are on the other side of the country, is there a good day and time for me to call?

 

Also on November 15th, you provided an initial clarification.  That same day the District acknowledged your clarification.  The District’s response is as follows:

I understand your request to be for a complete electronic copy of all public records requests received by the Richland School District #400 including the District’s responses for the years 2021-2021.

What I need clarification on is are you requesting all correspondence not just the initial request and the District’s response as there are time like this, that the District asks for clarification.  Further, there are requests that are abandoned.  By that I mean, the Requestor does not clarify or does not come to retrieve the responsive records.

Additionally, are you including requests for video in your request?  If so, the District will need to give third parties adequate notice of your request and the opportunity to seek an injunction.

I would prefer to speak over the phone with the member from your team who is making this request so that we can use our time more efficiently in responding to your request.  Please feel free to contact me directly.

 

You responded on November 16th by stating that your request was for copies of any public records requests received by the District and any responses to these requests by the District, including abandoned requests and requests for video. You also acknowledged the District’s need to give third-party notice.

 

On November 22, the District informed you that it was in the process of compiling a list of individuals who the District would need to provide third-party notice to and their contact information.  The District notified you that it was beginning the process of reviewing the responsive records to determine if there were any other necessary redactions. 

 

Based on the complexity of your request, the need to provide third party notice, and the need to carefully review the records for redactions, the District informed you it estimated it would take fourteen months to fully respond to your request. The District informed you that it would be providing the responsive records to you in installments.

 

The District also noted that it was in the process of updating its public records policy.  Part of that policy update related to fees associated with processing and answering records request. 

 

Starting on November 23rd, the District began received a large number of phone calls and e-mails from the individuals who had received the third-party notices.  Most individuals were concerned with who had requested the information and how the records would be used.

 

In a letter to you on December 1st the District asked that you complete a commercial purposes declaration.  This declaration clearly states that you are not seeking lists of employees and their disclosable information for commercial purposes.

 

On December 6th, the District received notice from you that you were neither seeking records for commercial purposes nor were you requesting any production of responsive documents that required a commercial purposes declaration. 

 

The District continued to receive considerable communications from third parties it had provided notice to regarding your request. Also, the District was reviewing the responsive records to make sure they included all necessary redactions and contained a redaction log.

 

The District e-mailed you installments to your records request by e-mail on the following dates:

January 3, 2022

February 3, 2022

February 3, 2022

February 4, 2022

 

On February 22nd, the District notified you that it was migrating to the GovQA platform to received, process and release all public records requests.  One of the many reasons for this migration is that the District can release responsive files that are significantly larger than what the District’s e-mail system can accommodate.  This allows for records to be release quicker.

 

On March 3rd, you notified the District that while the District was free to use the GovQA platform, you as a Requestor were under no obligation to use the platform. Further you started, “… as such I respectfully refuse.”  Further you wrote e-mailed the District:

The District is directed to provide the requested public records via email or direct no-password, no registration, internet file sharing link. If this is not possible, then responsive records my be provided via US MAIL.

US MAIL ADDRESS:

MuckRock
PRR: N000395-110421
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144

On March 17th, the District e-mailed you the following response:

As you know the District has been working to provide your agency with all responsive records.  Since starting to answer your request the District has begun using the GovQA portal/platform to assist the District in tracking and answering public records requests.  One of the reasons the District made this change is that prior to using GovQA, the District was limited in the size of the file it could send requestors.  GovQA does not have the limitations that the District’s e-mail server has.

Understanding that you are requesting the District to accommodate your request not to use GovQA, the District proposes that it start sending your group thumb drives that contain the responsive records.  The downside to this is that the thumb drives and postage will cost money.  Your group would be responsible for these fees.  Whereas if the District continued to answer your request using GovQA the District would not charge you a fee.

Please let us know how you would like to proceed.  The District has been inundated with public records request for the past several weeks, but we are committed to providing you with regular installments.

 

You acknowledged the District’s e-mail. You again said you would accept response records via US mail and again provided your mailing address in Sumerville, MA.

On March 17th, the District provided you with the following correspondence:

Dear MuckRock,

Richland School District received a public information request from you on November 04, 2021 and it is being processed in accordance with Chapter 42.56 RCW, the Washington State Public Records Act.

The District assigned your request with the reference number R000001-020722 for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when communicating about your request.

You requested the following records:

“all public records requests received by the District from November 14, 2011 through November 14, 2021. This includes the initial request, all responsive records from the District, and any redaction logs. Further your request also includes abandoned requests and requests for video records. Excluding list of names seeming for commercial purposes”

As you know the District has been working to provide your agency with all responsive records.  Since starting to answer your request the District has began using the GovQA portal/platform to assist the District in tracking and answering public records requests.  One of the reasons the District made this change is that prior to using GovQA, the District was limited in the size of the file it could send requestors.  GovQA does not have the limitations that the District’s e-mail server has.

Understanding that you are requesting the District to accommodate your request not to use GovQA, the District proposes that it start sending your group thumb drives that contain the responsive records.  The down side to this is that the thumb drives and postage will cost money.  Your group would be responsible for these fees.  Whereas if the District continued to answer your request using GovQA the District would not charge you a fee.

Please let us know how you would like to proceed.  The District has been inundated with public records request for the past several weeks, but we are committed to providing you with regular installments.

If you have any questions, please reply to this email. Thank you for your attention.

April 1st, 2022 – the District mailed you a thumb drive that contained 240 files of responsive records.  It also contained a bill for $36.95. This was sent to your mailing address.  The address the District used was:

MuckRock
PRR: N000395-110421
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144

 

On May 4th the District communicated to you the following:

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 04, 2021, Reference # R000001-020722.

Dear MuckRock,

We have not received your payment on invoice number INV22-R000001-1 for Public Records requested by you on November 04, 2021 with Request Number R000001-020722.  

Please see attached or login to the Public Records Request Center to view details.

You can make a check or money order payable to: Richland School District and mail to:

Attn: Nayomi Munguia
6972 Keene Road
West Richland WA 99353

Sincerely,  

Galt Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer
Legal

On September 20, 2022, the District sent to you a thumb drive to replace the two that you reported that you had not received.  There was no charge or fee for this as the last two that we have sent to you, have not been received by your organization.

 

The District is currently loading another installment of responsive record to a thumb drive and will mail it to you by the end of the week. The District will make sure this thumb drive is sent to your new address.

 

Over the past few days, the District has received several new requests from you.  On November 14, 2022, the District received the following public records request from you:

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2021. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2021 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2021.

3. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2020. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

4. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2020 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2020.

5. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2019. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

6. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2019 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2019.

The District acknowledges receiving your request.  The District has assigned this request the number R000176-111622. Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.    

Then on November 15, 2022, the District received another records request from you.  In this request you sought:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2019 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2019.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSRIPTS in the year 2019 can be excluded from this request.

The District has assigned this request the number R000175-111622.  Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.    

Today, the District received the following request from you:

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

The District acknowledges receiving this request.  The District has assigned it the number R000177-111622.  Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.

 

Again, the District is currently working on providing you with all responsive records to your original request. Richland School District Policy 4040 – Public Records Request provides in part, “When the same requester simultaneously submits multiple, separate requests or makes one or more additional requests when previous requests are open, the District may queue the requests in the order in which they were received. The District is not required to work on an additional request until the initial requests are completed and closed. Requesters are responsible for informing the Public Records Officer if they want to reprioritize the fulfillment of their requests.”

 

Therefore the District will answer your requests in the order it received them. If you want to prioritize your requests, please do so and let the District know which request you want the District to work on.

 

Unless you reprioritize the records requests, the District will continue to provide you with all responsive records to request #R000001-020722.  Within twenty working days after the District completes request # R000001-020722, it will provide you with the first installment of responsive records to request #R000175-111622. Then within twenty workings days after the District provides you with all responsive records to request ##R000175-111622, the District will provide you with the first installment of the responsive records to request #R000176-111622. And within twenty working days following completing request ##R000176-111622,the District will provide you with the first installment of request #R000177-111622. 

 

Please let me know if I misunderstood your request in any way or if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely,

 

 

Galt L. Pettett

Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian

Richland School District #400

6972 Keene Road

West Richland, WA  99353

galt.pettett@rsd.edu

(509)967-6009"

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT - Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) FINAL SUBMISSION, drafts, notes, worksheets, communications, estimates, and working documents for years 2019 - 2021
communications.communication:
December 5, 2022

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 136819
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

To Whom It May Concern:

I am really sorry for any confusion and the Richland School District is committed to answering all five of your public records requests in a timely fashion, but as I wrote to you previously, the District is currently working on your original public records request.  As you can imagine, producing complete copies of all public records requests received by the District and its responses to those requests between November 14, 2021 and November 14, 2021 including all abandoned requests and requests for video records takes a great deal of time. The District has worked diligently to answer your organization’s original request.

The District mailed you the most recent installment to your original request on Friday, December 2nd via USPS. The tracking number is 9505 5125 9791 2336 5843 64. It should be delivered today.

As I stated previously, District policy provides that the District is not required to work on separate requests made by the same requester at the same time. Therefore the District is working on your original request and then will work to answer your request number R000175-111622<https://rsdwa.govqa.us/WEBAPP/ZAdmin/ServiceRequests/Details.aspx?id=332&idx=3&totrecs=20&view=3&fromview=1&prevRequestId=333&nextRequestId=331&caller=%2FWEBAPP%2FZAdmin%2FServiceRequests%2FServiceRequestsPage.aspx%3Fsubpage%3Dlist%26view%3D3%26pg%3D0%26sort%3Dreference_no%26dir%3DDESC> that was received by the District on November 16th.

As I stated previously, you can re-prioritize your requests. If you wish the District to move your request for JLARC records to the front, please let the District know.  Again, the District is committed to answering all five of the different public records requests that your organization have made to the District. The District is also working on a number of other requests from other Requestors.

Sincerely,

Galt L. Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian
Richland School District #400
6972 Keene Road
West Richland, WA  99353
galt.pettett@rsd.edu<mailto:galt.pettett@rsd.edu>
(509)967-6009

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT - Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) FINAL SUBMISSION, drafts, notes, worksheets, communications, estimates, and working documents for years 2019 - 2021
communications.communication:
Via email: galt.pettett@rsd.edu

To whom it may concern,

Please direct my public records request dated 11-14-22 to the PUBLIC RECORDS OFFICER for Richland School District.

If in fact you Mr. Pettett are the "Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian" for Richland School District, you should familiarize yourself with the following organization:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reading_Is_Fundamental

If you read my original request dated 11-14-22, or my email of 11-28-22, or my email of 12-5-22, you would know that I have made a single PRA request directed to your Agency on a single date (11-14-22) via a UNIQUE email address: 136819-80187095@requests.muckrock.com



FROM: galt.pettett@rsd.edu 12-5-22:

"I am really sorry for any confusion and the Richland School District is committed to answering all five of your public records requests in a timely fashion, but as I wrote to you previously, the District is currently working on your original public records request. As you can imagine, producing complete copies of all public records requests received by the District and its responses to those requests between November 14, 2021 and November 14, 2021 including all abandoned requests and requests for video records takes a great deal of time. The District has worked diligently to answer your organization’s original request."

1. How and why you continue to whine about unrelated PRA requests does not interest me.

2. I do not belong to any "organization" nor did I ever represent that I did. To what "organization" are you refereeing and how does this "organization" relate to this public records request?

FROM: galt.pettett@rsd.edu 12-5-22:
"The District mailed you the most recent installment to your original request on Friday, December 2nd via USPS. The tracking number is 9505 5125 9791 2336 5843 64. It should be delivered today."

3. Great, that was quick. By "original" request you can only be referring to the ONLY request made of your agency dated 11-14-22.

 FROM: galt.pettett@rsd.edu 12-5-22:
"As I stated previously, District policy provides that the District is not required to work on separate requests made by the same requester at the same time. Therefore the District is working on your original request and then will work to answer your request number R000175-111622<https://rsdwa.govqa.us/WEBAPP/ZAdmin/ServiceRequests/Details.aspx?id=332&idx=3&totrecs=20&view=3&fromview=1&prevRequestId=333&nextRequestId=331&caller=%2FWEBAPP%2FZAdmin%2FServiceRequests%2FServiceRequestsPage.aspx%3Fsubpage%3Dlist%26view%3D3%26pg%3D0%26sort%3Dreference_no%26dir%3DDESC> that was received by the District on November 16th."

4. Again, only made the 11-14-22 PRA request. Let's get it right... and, back to reading is fundamental, please take note of the ORIGINAL 11-14-22 PRA REQUEST:

"PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

Please provide all electronic records in their native electronic format. Please do not create new records by printing native electronic files then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints for electronic production."

5. I will be nice and not tell you where to stick your GOVQA invitation/link. How about we just adhere to the PRA  request? Please and thank you. 

FROM: galt.pettett@rsd.edu 12-5-22:
"As I stated previously, you can re-prioritize your requests. If you wish the District to move your request for JLARC records to the front, please let the District know. Again, the District is committed to answering all five of the different public records requests that your organization have made to the District. The District is also working on a number of other requests from other Requestors."

6. I'll tell you what: go ahead and CANCEL all PRA requests ever sent to your agency other than the one I sent you dated 11-14-22 RE: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT - Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) FINAL SUBMISSION, drafts, notes, worksheets, communications, estimates, and working documents for years 2019 - 2021. Absolutely re-prioritize. Now, I have absolutely no authority whatsoever to modify other people's public records requests, but who cares? Go for it. Clear the deck and just work on this request only. Thanks.





********************************************************************
Via email: galt.pettett@rsd.edu
November 28, 2022

This is a follow up to a previous request:

Hello,

You seem to be confused. I made a single PRA request with your agency on 11-14-22. Copy attached. Thank you.
********************************************************************
Via email: galt.pettett@rsd.edu
December 5, 2022

This is a follow up to a previous request:

Hello,

Again, I made a single PRA request with your agency on 11-14-22.

When do you anticipate public records will be produced?

Thank you

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon:

I would like to start off as stating I am truly sorry for any frustration I have caused you. I take great pride in providing excellent services to Requestors. I am in no way trying to frustrate you or not comply with the Washington State Public Records Act.

In 2021, the Richland School District received a records request from an e-mail address containing “muckrock” in it.  In that request, the Requestor sought several years of records requests and the District’s response to those records request.  The District has been answering this original request by sending installments to the Boston address below.

Then in November, your request and others were received by the District from an e-mail address with “muckrock” in it.  Since these requests were all from “muckrock”, the District presumed they were all from the same organization.

Are there different employees of Muckrock making different requests?  Again, I truly want to provide you with the records you want and do not want to frustrate you, but maybe I don’t understand the Muckrock organization.

Any insight you can provide would be appreciated.

Thank you,


Galt L. Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian
Richland School District #400
6972 Keene Road
West Richland, WA  99353
galt.pettett@rsd.edu<mailto:galt.pettett@rsd.edu>
(509)967-6009

Dear Muck Rock - JLARC: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 11/14/2022 and given the reference number R000181-120822 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: •	The Richland School District’s 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state.  
•	Complete copies of worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes and e-mails related to the completion of the Richland School District’s 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate all responsive records and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted within five business days about the availability and/or provided with copies of responsive records or provided with an estimate of time it will take the District to answer your request.

Richland School District

The District received your records request on November 14th.  The District acknowledged your request on November 17th. Now understanding that you are an individual making the public records request, the District is working to answer your request. The District understands your request to be for the following records:

Please let me know if I have misunderstood your request in any way.

Sincerely,

Galt L. Pettett

West Richland, WA  99353

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R000181-120822
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 RE: Public Records Request of November 14, 2022, Reference # R000181-120822 Dear Muck Rock - JLARC, The Richland School District received a public records request from you on November 14, 2022. You requested the following records: • The Richland School District’s 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state. 
• Complete copies of worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes and e-mails related to the completion of the Richland School District’s 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state. The District received your records request on November 14 th.  The District acknowledged your request on November 17 th.  At the time, the District believed that MuckRock was an organization and not a platform for individual requestors to make public records requests. Now understanding that you are an individual making the public records request, the District is working to answer your request.  I estimate the District will have the first set of responsive records to you in the next three working days. 
The District understands your request to be for the following records: 
 
  *  The Richland School District’s 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state. Complete copies of worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes and e-mails related to the completion of the Richland School District’s 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state. As you may know, while the public records laws in Washington State are very broad and presume disclosure, they do not require a public agency to create a record to answer a request.  Therefore, if the District has records that answer your request, it will provide them to you as requested. Beginning December 1, 2022 the District will be charging for all public records requests.  Please see our policy and procedures for our fee schedule https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820578  and  https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820577 If you have any questions or if i have misunderstood your request in any way, please let me know by responding to this email. Sincerely, Nayomi Munguia 
Legal

Richland School District received a public records request from you on November 14, 2022. You requested the following records:

* The Richland School District's 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state.
* Complete copies of worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes and e-mails related to the completion of the Richland School District's 2019, 2020, and 2021 Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) reports submitted to the state.

The District's administration building and all of its schools are closed during winter break. Regardless, Richland School District has identified and located records responsive to your request. title: Complaints filed to Louisiana Public Service Commission

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Complaints filed to Louisiana Public Service Commission
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like a copy of all complaints regarding utilities filed to the Louisiana Public Service Commission between January 1st, 2021 and December 31st, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

communications.subject: RE: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Complaints filed to Louisiana Public Service Commission
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Louisiana Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 29, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: LPSC Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Grey,

The LPSC has received your public records request dated December 29, 2022 and the follow-up on January 4, 2023.  Unfortunately, it appears our fax machine has been malfunctioning and just received the request today.

For the request, the records you are seeking are for all public utility complaints for the period of 2021 and 2022.  The public utility complaints would include but not be limited to electric companies, water and wastewater companies, and telecommunications.  This request will likely result in thousands of pages of records (at $0.25/page) leading to possibly well over a thousand dollars.  Is there any way to narrow your serve to specific public utilities or narrowing to a smaller time period? Let me know how you want to proceed and again, our apologies for the delayed response. Thanks,

Colby Cook
Intergovernmental Policy & Communications Director
Louisiana Public Service Commission
Work: (225) 342-4999
Cell: (225) 505-1554

communications.subject: RE: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Complaints filed to Louisiana Public Service Commission
communications.communication:
Hi Colby,

Would you be able to limit this request to just water companies, between January 1st, 2021 and December 31st, 2022?

You noted the fee. I'm a journalist with Civil Eats requesting this for an article for the public benefit. I would like a fee waiver, if possible.

Best,
Grey

Colby

title: City Employee Salary Records (Miami Department of Fire)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: City Employee Salary Records (Miami Department of Fire)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Compensation data for all employees of the Fire Department for the most recent year in which complete data are available (preferably 2020).

Specifically, I request that these data include, for each employee: Name, Job Title, Earnings, and date of birth (or age), gender, ethnicity, and hire date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sam

communications.subject: PRR 23-840
communications.communication:
Good morning,



See the attached report in response to the PRR 23-840.


Please note that the report can only be run with an “as of “ date, so I used 10/1/2020 given it marks a new fiscal year.  Those who are Law Flag “Y” are FS119 Exempt, therefore, their DOB was not provided.





Respectfully,



Ryan Steed, Administrative Aide I

[cid:image001.png@01D958E6.7D3EA480]

City of Miami Office of the City Attorney

444 S.W. 2nd Avenue, Suite 945

Miami, Florida  33130

Telephone:  305-416-1817

Facsimile:  305-416-1801

RSteed@miamigov.com<mailto:rsteed@miamigov.com>

If you properly received this e-mail as a client or retained expert, please hold it in confidence to protect the attorney-client or work product privileges.  Should the intended recipient forward or disclose this message to another person or party, that action could constitute a waiver of the attorney-client privilege.  If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, or the agent responsible to deliver it to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any review, dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is prohibited by the sender and to do so might constitute a violation of the Electronic Communications Privacy Act, 18 U.S.C. section 2510-2521.  If this communication was received in error, we apologize for the intrusion.  Please notify us by reply e-mail and delete the original message.  Nothing in this e-mail message shall, in and of itself, create an attorney-client relationship with the sender. Under Florida Law, e-mail addresses and the contents of the e-mail are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address, or the contents of the e-mail, released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity.  Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing.



Please consider the environment before printing this e-mail.

title: Database of animal rescues

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Database of animal rescues
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An electronic list of all animals rescued by your department including the location, species, date and all other information logged in your database tracking system. I ask that the records simply be exported and delivered in a spreadsheet-like file format, such as CSV.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: FOIL Request #16072; your OpenRecords # FOIL-2023-846-00115
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Walsh:

I am contacting you from the Office of the General Counsel of NYC Department of Parks & Recreation. Please find attached a letter regarding your FOIL request.

title: Public Records Request

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to the Davidson County Sheriff, Wellpath and the Mental Health Cooperative are partners in the Sheriff's Behavioral Care Center: https://sheriff.nashville.gov/behavioral-care-center-bcc/

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, and other agreement documents between the Davidson County Sheriff Department and the Mental Health Cooperative.
- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, and other agreement documents between the Davidson County Sheriff Department and Wellpath.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: RE: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request

communications.subject: record request
communications.communication:
Mr. Hoover, I am in receipt of your request made on March 9, 2023 for:



- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, and other agreement documents between the Davidson County Sheriff Department and the Mental Health Cooperative.
- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, and other agreement documents between the Davidson County Sheriff Department and Wellpath.


Pursuant to Tenn. Code Ann. 10-7-503 et. seq., the Davidson County Sheriff's Office (DCSO) is providing you with a copy of the MOU between the DCSO and the Mental Health Cooperative (MHC). Also, pursuant to Tenn. Code Ann. 10-7-503, the DCSO denies the second request; DCSO and Wellpath are not in a contractual relationship. As such, the DCSO does not maintain the record of the contract between the Department of Health and Wellpath.
Best Regards,


Karen A. Fentress
Administrative Counsel
Davidson County Sheriff's Office
615-862-8216

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the North Dakota Bureau of Criminal Investigation's Face Recognition System

communications.subject: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the North Dakota Bureau of Criminal Investigation's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to learn: 1) which local, state and national law enforcement agencies can currently submit probe photos to be run through the Bureau of Criminal Investigation's face recognition system, and 2) which law enforcement agencies actually submitted probe photos to the Bureau for a search from January 1, 2020 to the date of the most recently available data.

Please provide any lists, logs or datasets showing this information.  With regard to agencies that have submitted probe photos, please provide logs, lists or datasets describing, as available, the requesting organization, the number of requests made, the dates of the requests, and the number of requests granted.  If the Bureau maintains this information in an Excel spreadsheet, I request that the record be produced in this format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

title: FOIL Request

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The metadata of emails which are sent to, from, including being CCed or BCCed by Byron Brown from January 1, 2022 to February 27, 2023 including the one of the following keywords:  "Public Safety Symposium", "Governor Hochul", or "FY23 Budget".

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

title: Standish Street Communications & Speed Study Data

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Standish Street Communications & Speed Study Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Seeking any and all communications between and among the Cambridge City Manager’s office, Cambridge City Councilors, the Cambridge Community Development Department, the Cambridge Department of Public Works, the Cambridge Fire Department and administration, and any/all residents of Standish Street on the matter of the temporary or permanent change of direction of Standish Street in the City of Cambridge, MA, along with the reasons for and safety ramifications of such a direction change. Please provide all communications between August 1st, 2015 and today.

In addition, I would also request any traffic and/or speed studies performed on Standish Street, both before and after its reconstruction and subsequent change of direction, including the actual vehicle-by-vehicle time and speed data from the speed study performed in late November/early December of 2017.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Doug Brown

title: Ambulance Transportation Contracts

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ambulance Transportation Contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any active ambulance transportation contracts for the hospitals at Pine Ridge, Rosebud, or Eagle Butte. This is to include ground and air ambulance operations, and to include 638 contracts such as with Rosebud Ambulance Service. This is also to include any contracts that the Great Plains area has entered into that impact those three facilities, such as the contract that had previously been in place with Eagle Air Med Corporation and Black Hills Life Flight.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cully Williams
